page.normal_text:
Masaya Takahashi (JMA) and Sebastien Wagner (EUMETSAT)
Masaya Takahashi (JMA)
and

2016 GSCIS annual meeting, 29 February - 4 March, 2016, Tsukuba, Japan

page.title:
Overview and Purpose
Overview and Purpose
page.normal_text:
2016 GSCIS annual meeting, 29 February - 4 March, 2016, Tsukuba, Japan
2016 GSCIS annual meeting, 29 February - 4 March, 2016, Tsukuba, Japan
page.enlisting:
▪ New GSICS product (GEO-LEO-VNIR) will enter Demo-Phase in 2016 • EUMETSAT GEO-LEO-VNIR product: in GPPA • Products (netCDF) will contain multiple calibration methods’ results in one file • NetCDF convention: almost fixed, but some issues (e.g. use of enhanced data • Requirement documents for GSICS Plotting Tool would be prepared by GRWG ❖ Purpose of this talk ▪ To introduce new product and GRWG requirement ▪ To discuss / get consensus on the requirement (incl. enhanced data model) ▪ New GSICS product (GEO-LEO-VNIR) will enter Demo-Phase in 2016
▪ New GSICS product (GEO-LEO-VNIR) will enter Demo-Phase in 2016 ▪ N e w

page.title:
Current Convention for the GEO- LEO-VISNIR (DCC) product
Current Convention for the GEO-
LEO-VISNIR (DCC) product
page.normal_text:
Basic idea: to follow existing GEO-LEO-IR convention
Basic idea: to follow existing GEO-LEO-IR convention

2016 GSCIS annual meeting, 29 February - 4 March, 2016, Tsukuba, Japan
2016 GSCIS annual meeting, 29 February - 4 March, 2016, Tsukuba, Japan
page.enlisting:
▪ E.g., W_XX-EUMETSAT-Darmstadt,SATCAL+RAC+GEOLEOVNIR,MSG3+SEVIRI- ❖ netCDF Convention ▪ Global attributes  Nothing special issues to be discussed ▪ Variables • Basic variables (e.g. date, channel name) • Official calibration coefficients (This will also be discussed for GEO-LEO-IR) • Specific variables to GSICS VISNIR products in order to support multiple ▪ E.g., W_XX-EUMETSAT-Darmstadt,SATCAL+RAC+GEOLEOVNIR,MSG3+SEVIRI-

page.title:
When to Use the Enhanced Data Model – from 2011 Unidata NetCDF Workshop
When to Use the Enhanced Data Model
– from 2011 Unidata NetCDF Workshop
page.normal_text:
2016 GSCIS annual meeting, 29 February - 4 March, 2016, Tsukuba, Japan
2016 GSCIS annual meeting, 29 February - 4 March, 2016, Tsukuba, Japan
page.enlisting:
 Enhanced data model: offers rich features for structuring data, but breaks  Classic model: simple, well-understood, and had been around for a long time • Data using the classic model can be read by all existing netCDF software • Writing programs for classic model data is easier • Most or all existing netCDF conventions are targeted at the classic model • Many great features, like compression, parallel I/O, large data sizes, etc., are • Complex data structures can be represented very easily in the data, leading  Enhanced data model: offers rich features for structuring data, but breaks
 Enhanced data model: offers rich features for structuring data, but breaks  E n h a n c e d
